description: I love it. Simply the best.
Best replacement for AIMP on Linux. Makes managing a very large music collection as painless as it can possibly get!
summary: Does all I wanted and a little more

description:
Used "musicbee" under windows and have to say this is even better!
Awesome app!
Excellent, I have no better word to describe it.
summary: Ruling over everything I've tried before

description: Well done, intelligent application. Straightforward editing of tags permits correct organization of music collection, long list of plugins further expands utility. Could profit from more documentation, although existing FAQ very helpful.
I tried all music player for my Fedora. Quod Liber is the best app with big plugins for awesome my listen experience.
summary: Fast app for large music archive

description:
This is a real app for music. The UI is clean, functional and elegant. It can also be personalized via plugins. Talking about plugins, it already has tons of them, ready to be used.
What bought me was the option to browse the music from file system, via folder. Thanks for this! (coming from fedoramagazine)
summary: Impressive! Clean UI, browse from file system and tons of plugins

description: The best on nix systems. Unless you are able to emulate MusicBee with all dependencies. Still needs configurable shortcuts and more polish on the plugin system.
The amount of customisation alongside usability this player gives you is unmatched. I was looking fora foobar2000 replacement and this Quod Libet beyond that.
The best music player on linux, finally I can customise a player to mimic what I'm used to on windows. needs polish but can easily be tweaked to look good.
summary: The best in terms of configuration

description: Does everything and more with plugins
Works without problems.
it dose not uninstall.
perfect, you can browse by folders too o/
After trying many of the offerings in this category, I landed on Quod Libet / Ex Falso: perfect combination!

Significantly worse than Clementine. It has no decent view for Artist -> Album. Instead, you are presented with "People" and "Album", as if "People" is the Band name. For one group, I ended up with 19 different groupings because there was s different list of song writers.

Simple and powerful, yet I wish there was a way to have the sidebar display by Artist List, like it does for Albums List (via the Browse menu), since I prefer to select an artist i feel like listening to and then just shuffle/repeat the entire artist catalogue.
I'm running Fedora 32 Gnome, and this app keeps disappearing when I restart my machine. Quite weird actually.
summary: It keeps uninstalling itself? But it's a great app

description: Bit-perfect and regexp, what else could you ask for?! ;-)
summary: The best audio player for Linux

description: It support non-free file format like Net Ease Music's file format. Amazing work for that supporting. Thanks.
summary: An amazing tool support a large number of non-free format!

description: some other reviews say that this is the best music player for linux. well, if this is the best, then i don't want to knnow about the other music players for linux. it's time for apple to release a linux version of itunes.
In my opinion, by far the best music manager for Linux users.

Really good cross-platform audiophile-grade music player that works well on both Linux and Mac (tested). It uses a classic Foobar2000 styled UI. However, this type of music player is not for people that like iTunes.

It handles large music collections efficiently, is quick to find new music (re-scan library), and can be used with organized folder structures. File and batch tagging works well. Furthermore, I recommend enabling the "waveform seek bar" and "replay gain" plugins. The latter permits to calculate replay gain for music files, albums, or the entire library.
Overall, the main UI is well thought out (and somewhat adaptable). However, some detail "set once and forget" settings are somewhat hidden.
Does most anything I want from a music player with robust functionality and a nice design

Based on the principle that we know better than the software developers how we want our music organised, this has got to be the best-designed software for managing large music libraries.
Never had any problems or bugs in it, either.
It would be better if version 4.4.0 was here instead of the outdated 4.2, though.
summary: Feature-rich and highly customisable, but simple too

description:
Easy to use app. Installation of the deb had no problems.
Application works as advertised.
Very basic and very poor audio player. Very slow to read it's own database. No smart playlists. Crashed on first use. Uninstalling.
But the UI is a little clunky and there isn't any option to show "comments" in the columns.
I am using it since around 2 years. There is a bit of a learning curve but once that is behind you... just enjoy your last music player you ever downloaded ;-)
summary: Every day go to music player

description: Boring and difficult UI to use and of course no timer/scheduler. It seems impossible for Linux boffins to create a music player as versatile and good looking as Aimp3, unfortunately only for Windows...
You can edit the tags, you cannot trim 14 seconds off of an otherwise GREAT track for the kids.

Great interface with multiple views.

Very simple presentation.

Reads Replay Gain tags.

Lots of plugins including Replay Gain scanning.
I've found Quod Libet to have the best UI for my needs, and I've been impressed with its ability to manage large music collections and manage tags well
You can't change keyboard shortcuts.
You can't change keyboard shortcuts.

Incredible re-imagining of Rhythmbox. Has the same quality management tools, even better GNOME integration, and the same classic iTunes-like layout that will never get old. 

It also has the same features, except one MASSIVE one. No MTP support. Why have a music collection manager if you can't sync that collection with an on-the-go music player? We've lived in a post-Walkman world for like 40 years. We don't have to plug into a gramophone and sit still to listen to music anymore. 

I'm not just picking on FOSS devs here, they consciously decided not to support this. It's like if Plex decided to remove the Remote Access feature.

Yes, there is a plugin, but it's very hacky. You have to set up rsync to successfully transfer media, which defeats its purpose entirely. This is a self-proclaimed "music management program." What is there to manage without support for MTP devices? Tags? So what? That's not management. There are tons of GTK tag editors anyway. There's only one or two very outdated GTK-based programs that reliably support MTP.

Why not fill that void instead of adding to the pile of programs that don't do what it's supposed to? As it is now, this is a good looking music player and tag editor, but it is not a music management app.
summary: "So close, yet so far" has never been so applicable..

description: This is the most accomplished music player available. I love that it can play from folder hierarchies, that it handles tags, all the audio quality and plugin settings, etc.

I really like this music player for its adaptabillity and miriad of codecs,it actually plays my .ape files. It is a shame,therefore, that at present I have a problem where it holds on to a process making it necessary to kil the process before unmounting my external drives prior to shutdown
It couldn't play have the formats and it took all my different directories of music and combined them into one play list. Horrible!
I have tried different music apps on different OS and this one is the best. Note: it needs MPRIS D-Bus Support plugin for DE (Gnome) integration.

has differnet views of music library, media buttons work if you activate the MPRIS plugin, no mini view or dark mode, has an EQ, playlists (dragndrop), but lyrics are broke.

replaygain support (lowercase only), no way to compute gain values, but you can edit them.

player will slowy raise volume on quite tracks but you miss the begining without adjusting the volume, which defetes the purpose of loudness normailzion.
summary: does a lot, just not enough

description: the program runs well but one day i wanna listen music and the program crash after start the music very dissapointed

Endlich habe ich einen fast ebenbürtigen Ersatz für das leider kläglich verstorbene Banshee gefunden. Kommt im Gegensatz zu Anderen hervorragend und schnell mit meinen Musikdaten auf einer NTFS-Partition klar die auch von einem wahlweise laufenden Windows genutzt wird. Durch EX FALSO einfache und hervorragende Bearbeitung der Meta-Daten möglich. Also gute 4 Punkte von mir, da mir der einfache Import mit Datenkonvertierung und vorheriger Meta-Daten Bearbeitung fehlt (ach Banshee)
summary: Top Programm für die Organisation der Audiobibliothek

description: Sehr gute Musikverwaltung!

Besonders gefällt mir, dass man sich die Ansicht und Spalten beliebig konfigurieren kann. Es ist blitzschnell (Import) und aktualisiert die Bibliothek nach Änderungen an der Ordnerstruktur sofort. Im Gegensatz zu Rhythmbox speichert Quod Libet seine Einstellungen nicht in den gsettings und die Änderungen an der Bibliothek (Ratings bspw.) gehen nach Neueinrichtung eines Systems nicht verloren.
Unterstützt alle Formate und Funktionen und enthält viele Plugins. Bringt Übersicht, ermöglicht angenehmes Taggen und zwingt keine Verzeichnisstruktur auf.
Die einzige Anwendung mit der ich meine eigenen Tags als Spalte anzeigen bzw. sortieren lassen kann. (etwas Einarbeitung nötig). Andere Programme arbeiten meist nur mit vorgegebenen Tagnamen.
oldie but goldie ... für mich einer der besten player / manager

Super Verwaltung der Musiksammlung und gleichzeitige Möglichkeit, Tags anzupassen (und vor allem auch Massenbearbeitung). Sehr gut Anpassbarkeit von Spalten und Layout, damit die gewünschen Infos in der Übersicht sind.
Weiter ist auch der Filter sehr gut nutzbar und die Zahlreichen Plugins ergänzen den Funktionsumfang.
para escuchar y organizar tu musica facil de usar y nos muestra las caratulas reales de las canciones que se estan escuchando.
Sencilla y directa muy buena aplicaciòn
Nada más que agregar.
deja de sonar, organiza como quiere, una patata
simple y dispone de varios plugins para modificarlo

Je n'écoute que des disques, et de musique classique la plupart du temps. Quodlibet donne tout ce qu'il faut pour ça : on peut modifier les étiquettes, voir sa discothèque sous divers formats. Et on n'est pas submergé par une multitude de renseignements dont on n'a rien à faire. Seule critique : la recherche porte sur les disques (albums en franglais) et non sur les titres des morceaux, ou alors je n'ai pas trouvé comment faire.
Je trouve que c'est le lecteur avec le meilleur son (Kubuntu 19.10) avec Winamp (avec Wine)
Quoi qu'on puisse penser d'Apple, iTunes reste ce qui se fait de mieux pour gérer une bibliothèque musicale. Et bien voici sa version Linux, encore plus personnalisable !! Le top !!

Devrait être l'application par défaut d'Ubuntu et ses variantes.

Avant toutes choses :
Aller dans navigation, liste des albums ou faire ctrl 4.
Ajouter deux trois greffons pour la rendre plus intuitive.
- Waveform seekbar
- Télécharger des illustrations
 
1 Ne plante pas (comme clémentine par exemple).
2 Modifiable avec les greffons (certains ne fonctionnent pas très bien mais il y aura un message d'erreur).
3 S'intègre parfaitement avec l'environnement de bureau.
4 Organiser sa bibliothèque est plutôt facile avec les autres greffons ... musicbrainz etc.. et avoir les illustrations de pochettes.

Excellent taf merci
Génial! il ne manque plus que la possibilité de se connecter à mon iphone pour mettre à jour les fichiers musique
summary: facile d'utilisation et pleins d'outils super

description: se méfier des tags de brain car ils changent en fonction des albums et non des titres
summary: Super bon gestionnaire de collections audio

description: Очень удобный, рекомендую всем.

Прекрасное приложение. Недаром куча звезд и форков на GitHub. 
Все, что надо найдено сразу. Остальное найти просто. Давно искал удобную программу управления музыкой с поддержкой интернет-радио и аудио каналов. Радует, что приложение активно развивается. Успехов!

На выбор несколько вариантов раскладки окон, можно даже выбрать просто по папкам сортировку, а можно список альбомов с обложками слева и список треков справа. Вот такого функционала не хватает большинству плееров.
все работает отлично.гараздо удобнее чем встроенный плеер .Rhythmbox.Оформление бы еще какое нибудь темного цвета.Разроботчикам респект.
summary: все работает отлично.гараздо удобнее чем встроенный плеер .Rhythmbox

description: Нашел в приложении все функции, которое только хотел от музыкального плеера. Все очень удобно. Бонусом радует прекрасный набор радиостанций.
Один из немногих плееров, которые умеют играть отдельную папку, и при этом современно выглядят.
хороший звук. Качественный эквалайзер.
